intro: Tocoyena longilobata, commonly known as the long-lobed tocoyena, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features strap-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight. Tocoyena longilobata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
